results.title: The Image of the city
results.creator_credit: Charles Eames, Ray Eames, Smithsonian Institute and Westinghouse Electric Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the Eames exhibition ‘Photography and the City’ designed for the Smithsonian Institute. This documentary looks at the changing representation of cities based on the available technologies of the time. In the late nineteenth century photography not only provided popular views of distant monuments and foreign cities, but by rendering things and events objectively, became a valuable tool in the examination of social systems. At the turn of the century, photographers experimented with kites to capture aerial images of cities. Today [1969], specialists working in environmental fields are using a wide variety of photographic techniques to study and clarify urban problems. Tools such as multiband cameras, radar images , computer-generated graphics, satellite observations and thermograms are making available new information about our cities, their environment, and the influences upon them. Alex Funke, Parke Meek and David Olney involved in production, music by Gerald Fried.

results.title: The Image of empire: the early Roman Empire and the rise of christianity
results.creator_credit: Mary Hoskins, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: How, in the absence of modern means of communication can a Roman Emperor project an image of himself and his rule? J. Ferguson discusses the various forms of imperial propaganda which included patriotic writing, the use of inscriptions, coinage, sculpture and public works.

results.title: I'm still a woman
results.creator_credit: Joyce Mann and Joyce Mann Productions
results.brief_description: Three weeks before her wedding, Mrs Joyce Mann discovered that she had a lump in her breast. After a mastectomy she and her husband found just how few facilities there were for women who were considered mutilated. Before a group of nurses, Mrs Mann explains and demonstrates her experience, and the underwear she has worn and now wears. Another cancer victim shows that now, at times breasts can be reconstructed.

results.title: I'm positive that's sugar
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Intended for discussion use. This film to be used to introduce the new Primary Science course. Children are seen and heard as they classify and group various materials. Observations and “experiments” are carried out.

results.title: I'm no fool with fire
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket shows how humans have depended on fire through the ages and describes the rules of fire safety, how to extinguish a fire and the most effective ways of fire prevention.

results.title: I'm no fool in water
results.brief_description: Jiminy Cricket tells something of the history of swimming as a sport and goes on to describe the safety rules for swimming. Among these are the right and wrong places to swim, the chief water hazards, the need to wait two hours after eating and to swim in company.

results.title: I'm going to school today (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Primary education in Australia. Discusses the changes in school environment and teaching methods. How well does the present education prepare a child to take his place in a fast changing modern world, where the emphasis is on adaptability?

results.title: I'm dependent, you're addicted
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Takes a look at the medical facts about the five main groups of abused drugs, examining some of the popular misconceptions about drug dependence. Shows how the illegal drug problem grows out of legal drug abuse. Uses laboratory animals to show effects. Touches upon unpublished American research into cannabis.

results.title: [ILO Webster]
results.creator_credit: Bert Kroon, John van der Heulen and Toonder Studios
results.brief_description: Unless we all work together the great problems of over population and massive unemployment has little chance of being overcome. This animated film discusses the problems and suggests possible ways of tackling them.
